document.docAuthor: Alipanah, Helen, Yakovlev, Roman, Falsafi, Hossein, Witt, Thomas & Saldaitis, Aidas

subSubSection.paragraph:
Phalaena-Bombyx
cossus Linnaeus, 1758
, Syst. Nat.: 504.

LT: Sweden . Type material ( syntypes ) in LSL
.
Synonymy:

=
Bombyx unguiculatus Fabricius, 1793
, Ent. Syst. emendata aucta 3 (2): 4.

LT: Italy . Type material (? syntypes ) probably in MNHC
.

=
Cossus ligniperda Fabricius, 1793
, Ent. Syst. emendata aucta 3 (2): 3.

LT: Sweden . Type material is lost
.

=
Cossus balcanicus Lederer, 1863
, Wien . Ent. Monatschr. 7: 22.

LT: Sliwno [ Sliven , Bulgaria ]. Type material ( holotype ) in MHUB
.

= Cossus cossus
ab. (et var.?) subnigra O. Schultz, 1911 , Soc. Ent. 25: 84.

LT: Germany . Type material ( holotype ) in DEIM
.

=
Cossus cossus
f. aceris Griep, 1918 , Int. Ent. Zeitschr. 12 (11): 84.

LT: Hercyniae mont. (
Harzgebirge in der Nähe
von Wernigerode) [ Sachsen-Anhalt , Germany ]. Type material ( syntypes ) probably in MHUB
.

= Cossus cossus
ab.
nigra Dietze, 1919
, Ent. Zschr. 33: 4.

LT: Locarno am Lago [border between Switzerland and Italy ]. Type material ( syntypes ) probably in MHUB
.

=
Cossus cossus stygianus Stichel, 1908
, Berl. Ent. Zeitschr. 53: 123.

LT: Storbach , Lulea-Elf [river Lulea-Elf, N. Sweden ]. Type material ( syntypes ) in coll. H. Rangnow , probably lost
.

Host plants.
Cydonia Mill.
,
Malus
L.,
Prunus
L.,
Pyrus
L.,
Cerasus
L.,
Olea
L.,
Fraxinus
L.,
Morus
L.,
Hippophae
L.,
Eleagnus
L.,
Populus
L.,
Platanus
L.,
Salix
L.,
Betula
L.,
Alnus
L.,
Sorbus
L.,
Tilia
L.,
Fagus
L.,
Quercus
L.,
Acer
L.,
Ulmus
L.,
Vitis
L.,
Aesculus
L.,
Sambucus
L.,
Diospyros
L.,
Salix
L.,
Citrus
L.,
Caragana Fabr.
,
Lonicera
L.,
Eriobotrya japonica (Thunb.) Lindl.
,
Juglans regia
L. ( Chneour 1955 ; Gómez-Bustillo & Fernándes-Rubio 1976; Rungs 1979 ; Skinner 1985 ; Barakanova 1986 ; Schoorl 1990 ; Speidel 1994 ;
Bertaccini et al . 1997
;
Buser et al . 2000
;
Piskunov et al . 2000
).

Remarks. This species is represented by three subspecies,
C. cossus araraticus Teich, 1896
,
C. cossus kossai
Wiltshire, 1957 , and
C. cossus kopetdaghi Yakovlev, 2009
, in Iran (
Yakovlev 2009b
).
